title: I want to learn financial management. What will be the recommended books and free online courses? - Quora

response.answer_text: Consider reading SkilledUp's article, Test Drive a College Finance Major.  In that article, the following free courses are explored:   Introduction to Finance – Professor Gautam Kaul, University of Michigan. An Introduction to Corporate Finance – Professor Franklin Allen, Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.Financial Theory – Professor John Geanakoplos, Yale University.An Introduction to Financial Accounting – Brian J Bushee, Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.Investments – Professor Reto Gallati, Massachusetts institute of Technology (MIT).Introduction to Computational Finance and Financial Econometrics – Professor Eric Zivot, University of Washington.Entrepreneurial Finance – Professor Antoinette Schoar, MIT.Fundamentals of Personal Financial Planning – Professor Don DeBok, University of California, Irvine.Behavioral Economics and Finance – Professor Xavier Gabaix, MIT.Taxes and Business Strategy – Professor George Plesko, MIT.The Politics of Global Financial Relations – Professor David Andrew Singer, MIT.The Law of Corporate Finance and Financial Markets – Professor John Akula, MIT.Financial Management – Professor Jonathan Lewellen, MIT.Financial Markets – Professor Bob Shiller, Yale University.(Disclosures:  I work for SkilledUp. My coworker, Joseph Mapue, wrote the above article.)

Consider course based notes for a general idea available on various websites. However, the books I can suggest are:- The basics of Public Budgeting And Financial Management by Charles E. Menifield.When Genius Failed: The Rise and Fall of Long-Term Capital Management —by — Roger Lowenstein.Financial Management by I.M. Pandey.Online courses can be availed from various Ed- Tech platforms like Talentedge, Simplilearn, etc. that run online certificate courses that are affiliated to top-notch institutes.
